elements.title: Cytokine cocktail drives resting NK to memory-like NK / INKmune Generates Memory-like NK Cells

data.value: SciTranslMed 2016, Romee, Fenheger, et al

Cytokine Induced Memory Like (CIML) NK cells and INKmune primed NK (TpNK) cells phenotypically identical. Advantages of memory-like NK cells: Increased cytotoxicity, persistence, proliferation, active against solid tumors.

elements.title: MUC4 Expression and Resistance to Trastuzumab in Breast Cancer

data.value: MUC4 expressing triple negative breast cancer patients have a worse overall survival.
MUC4 expression is a biomarker of resistance that may improve therapeutic decision making.
Combination therapy with INB03 overcomes resistance in breast cancer.
MUC4 expression is relevant to all tumors that express HER2 or MUC4.

elements.title: Dendritic Cell Therapies and Other Immunotherapy Approaches

data.value: FDA-approved therapy involves collecting monocytes, maturing them into dendritic cells, and re-infusing after loading with cancer antigens.
Current clinical results of dendritic cell therapies are mixed.
Genetically engineered T-cells demonstrate anti-tumor activity but require complex and costly manufacturing processes.
Current trials report severe adverse toxicities requiring hospitalization.
Block the tumor's ability to evade the immune system; six currently approved.
Critical for innate immunity, they directly eliminate diseased cells.
Neutralizes soluble TNF in tumor microenvironment, potentially enhances effectiveness of cancer therapy.
MUC4 expression inhibits binding of trastuzumab; INB03 may allow effective treatment.

elements.title: Phase I and II Trials with INB03 and XPro

data.value: Completed Phase I trial with INB03 in oncology and a Phase I trial with XPro in patients with Alzheimer’s.
Phase II program for Alzheimer’s disease started in 2022.
First interaction with regulatory body in March 2018, second in March 2019.
Approved to initiate Phase I trial with INB03 on May 21, 2018 and XPro in May 2019, Phase II for mild AD on January 5, 2022.
First interaction with FDA in July 2020 for Phase II Quellor program for COVID-19.
Comparability testing between drugs used in trials is underway.
Developed for treating Alzheimer’s focusing on neuroinflammation.
Plans to use INB03 as a combination therapy in various cancers.
Changing focus from cytotoxic to immunotherapy-based regimens, including combination therapies with drugs like TDxd.
Ongoing pre-clinical studies of INB03.
The Company plans to pursue an eﬃcient registration strategy using XPro to improve the lives of patients with Alzheimer's disease with biomarkers of inflammation (ADi).
The Company believes ADi is not the only indication for XPro in neurodegenerative and neuropsychiatric diseases.
Received NIMH funding to support a Phase II TRD program hoping to start patient enrollment in 2023.
Two partnering opportunities with XPro: traditional partnership for all neurodegenerative applications and focused partnership for combination therapy.
After proof-of-concept Phase II studies, the Company will determine the most efficient registration strategy.
Exploring partnership opportunities with DN-TNF for Duchene Muscular Dystrophy (DMD), highlighting the need for better therapies.
In collaboration with UC Irvine, studies show that DN-TNF therapy decreases inflammation, promotes muscle regeneration, and decreases fibrosis.
The Company has filed global IP for DN-TNF to treat muscular dystrophy, placed with subsidiary DN02, Inc. for co-development.
The Company is actively seeking a partner for DN-TNF development for DMD.

elements.title: Market Acceptance and Regulatory Challenges for INKmune

data.value: Market acceptance of INKmune may be hindered by physician's and patient's reluctance to switch from existing therapies.
The degree of market acceptance will depend on efficacy, safety, market pricing, reimbursement, and marketing efforts.
Regulatory approvals may impose restrictions that limit how the product is manufactured and marketed.
Manufacturing must comply with current Good Manufacturing Practices and will be subject to regulatory inspections.
The commercial success of our product candidates depends largely on reimbursements by health maintenance organizations, government health authorities, and private insurers.
Marketing approvals, pricing, and reimbursement for new drug products vary from country to country, potentially delaying commercial launches.
There are significant uncertainties regarding our patent applications and the potential infringement of third-party patents.
The manufacture and sale of therapeutic products are subject to extensive regulatory approvals which are time-consuming and costly.
Competition from established pharmaceutical companies and emerging biotech firms poses a significant risk to our market position.

elements.title: FDA Regulatory Compliance for Pharmaceutical Products

data.value: An NDA must contain extensive manufacturing information, proposed labeling, chemistry and physical characteristics of the drug.
The manufacturing process must consistently produce quality products within specifications approved by the FDA.
The FDA conducts inspections of manufacturing facilities to ensure compliance with cGMP.
Products are subject to continuous regulation, including record-keeping, reporting of adverse experiences, and changes to approved products.
The FDA regulates marketing, labeling, advertising, and promotion of pharmaceutical products, prohibiting promotion of off-label uses.
Prohibits remuneration in exchange for patient referrals involving federal healthcare programs.
Failure to comply may result in adverse publicity, corrective advertising, and potential civil and criminal penalties.
We have incurred significant losses since our inception and anticipate that we will continue to incur losses for the foreseeable future.

Our ability to successfully engage with, and satisfactorily respond to, requests for additional information from the FDA concerning the clinical hold on our investigational new drug application for XPro.

We will require additional capital to fund our operations and if we fail to obtain necessary financing, we will not be able to complete the development and commercialization of our product candidates.
We have a substantial amount of debt, and we may be unable to make required payments of interest and principal.
We are significantly dependent on the success of our DN-TNF product platform and Natural Killer Cell Priming Platform (INKmune).
We need to attract and retain highly skilled personnel; we may be unable to effectively manage growth with our limited resources.
We depend upon our senior management and key consultants; their loss could put us at a competitive disadvantage.
The biotechnology and immunotherapy industries are characterized by rapid technological developments and a high degree of competition.
We can provide no assurance that our clinical product candidates will obtain regulatory approval.
Drug discovery and development is a complex, time-consuming and expensive process with a high rate of failure.
We may face legal claims; legal disputes are expensive.
We must comply with significant government regulations.
We rely upon patents to protect our technology; we may be unable to protect our intellectual property rights.
The price of our common stock may be volatile.
Our Rights Agreement contains anti-takeover provisions that could discourage a change in control.

elements.title: Risk Factors Related to Intellectual Property

data.value: Patent applications limited in scope, risk to market products due to insufficient protection.
Dependent on licenses from Xencor and Immune Ventures.
Potential termination of licenses may harm competitive position.
Limited financial information complicates evaluation of performance.
Educational and regulatory challenges for novel therapies like INKmune.

elements.title: Risk Associated with Clinical Trials and Marketing Approval

data.value: Even with positive results in earlier development, additional setbacks may occur during late-stage clinical trials.
Flaws in design may not be apparent until trials are advanced.
Preclinical and clinical data are often subject to varying interpretations.
Variability exists in safety and efficacy results across different trials.
There is a high failure rate for drug candidates in clinical trials.
The FDA may not grant marketing approval even with favorable trial results.
Setbacks can materially harm business, financial condition, and prospects.
Preliminary data may be subject to change and should be viewed with caution.

elements.title: Risks Related to Clinical Trials and Regulatory Approvals

data.value: We may experience delays or fail to reach agreements on clinical trial contracts or protocols.
Patients may misrepresent their eligibility or not comply with protocols, increasing enrollment requirements.
Participants in clinical trials may be exposed to unacceptable health risks, resulting in suspension or termination.
Regulatory bodies may disagree with trial designs or data interpretations, affecting approval.
Quality and supply issues concerning raw materials may impact clinical trials and product development.
Regulatory approval policies may change, affecting the marketability of product candidates.
Delays in clinical trials may shorten exclusive commercialization rights and allow competitors market entry.
Increased testing delays may raise the costs of product development and require additional funding.

elements.title: Risk Factors in Clinical Trials and Orphan Drug Designation

data.value: Could lead to increased development costs and jeopardize the company's ability to achieve clinical goals.
Failure or delays in approval of proposed product brand names may adversely impact business.
May not confer expected market exclusivity, and other companies may obtain approval for the same indication.
Smaller target patient populations may adversely affect revenue.
Failure to comply can result in fines and suspended approvals.

elements.title: Risks Related to Operations and Compliance

data.value: Potential adverse impact due to infectious diseases such as COVID-19 on research and development activities.
Possible inability to predict the extent of future business shutdowns and their effects on operations.
Significant impact on operating results due to operations outside the U.S.
Possible noncompliance with regulatory standards could harm reputation and lead to liability.
Threats include security breaches and loss of confidential information due to reliance on technology.
Potential regulatory noncompliance and public relations issues stemming from social media interactions.
No intention to pay dividends in the foreseeable future, affecting stock market perception.

elements.title: Proposed Phase I Study in patients with high-risk MDS

data.value: Initiation of an open label Phase I cancer study in patients with high-risk myelodysplastic syndrome (MDS). Patients are being enrolled who have a low burden of disease after completion of conventional therapy.
Monitor changes in peripheral blood NK activation, NK function and changes in residual blast counts in blood and bone marrow.
First patients enrolled in the first quarter of 2021.
Patients with detectable residual disease in bone marrow and/or peripheral blood are being treated with intravenous infusions of INKmune.

elements.title: Guidance on Clinical Trials and Drug Development

data.value: Phase I trials initiated in the UK and Australia.
CTA approval received from MHRA for INKmune trial in ovarian cancer.
Initial Phase I sites expected in the UK.
Planned as multinational, including potential sites in the US.
Combination therapy with INB03 and existing treatments.
Registration and development strategy for INB03 planned for multiple regions.
Monitoring other drug developments in Alzheimer's treatment.

elements.title: Federal False Claims and Statement Laws

data.value: Imposes liability on those presenting fraudulent claims to federal health care programs.
Actions may be brought by the Attorney General or as qui tam actions.
Violations can result in significant monetary penalties and treble damages.
The federal government investigates compliance with fraud laws, especially in the pharmaceutical sector.
Prohibits fraudulent schemes to deceive healthcare benefit programs.
The Affordable Care Act imposes new reporting requirements on manufacturers.
Fines of up to $150,000 per year for failures to report accurately.
States may have broader fraud and abuse statutes.
Current challenges in obtaining coverage and adequate reimbursement from third-party payors.

elements.title: FDA Regulatory Review and Acceleration Considerations

data.value: Accelerated approval under FDCA available for serious or life-threatening conditions.
Priority review does not guarantee faster approval.
Clinical trials can be lengthy and expensive with uncertain outcomes.
High failure risk for product candidates in development stage.
FDA has broad discretion on priority review status.
Additional studies may be required to obtain approval.
Determination of therapeutic benefits is clinically significant.
Accelerated approval contingent on post-approval studies.
No assurance of NDA submission decision after evaluation.
The company faces substantial competition from other pharmaceutical and biotechnology companies in developing and commercializing new drug products.
The company may face challenges in establishing internal sales, marketing, and distribution capabilities.
The success of the company heavily relies on Dr. Raymond J. Tesi, President and CEO, and other key personnel.
There is a risk of product liability claims which could significantly affect the company's operations and financial condition.
Maintaining adequate general liability insurance is essential, but coverage may not fully protect against all potential liabilities.
We have not declared any cash dividends on our common stock since inception and do not anticipate paying such dividends in the foreseeable future.
We plan to retain any future earnings for use in our business operations.

elements.title: Healthcare System Regulatory Changes and Their Impact on Pharmaceutical Products

data.value: U.S. and foreign jurisdictions considering regulatory proposals affecting healthcare system.
Contain costs, improve quality, expand access.
Introduced fees, extended Medicaid rebates, and changed pricing methodologies.
Budget Control Act 2011 reduces Medicare payments, American Taxpayer Relief Act increased recovery period for overpayments.
U.S. Supreme Court dismissed recent ACA challenge.
Review of policies limiting healthcare access.
Eliminates Medicaid drug rebate cap starting January 1, 2024.
Congressional inquiries into drug pricing practices.
Imposes Medicare price negotiations and rebates for inflation.
State legislatures controlling pharmaceutical pricing through various measures.
Lower reimbursement leading to decreased profitability.

elements.title: FDA Clinical Hold on XPro and Competition Risks

data.value: FDA has placed a clinical hold on XPro, requesting additional information.
Potential adverse effects on development timelines, business, and stock price.
Competitors may have greater resources and could gain FDA approval before the company.
Challenges in protecting patents could limit commercialization efforts.
Variability in patent protection across countries could challenge market position.

elements.title: Risks Related to Regulatory Issues and Marketing Approval

data.value: If our product candidates receive marketing approval but later identified as less effective or harmful, our ability to market them could be compromised.
Clinical trials may indicate an apparent effect greater than actual or fail to identify side effects.
Potential adverse events include withdrawal of approval, recalls, fines, or civil penalties.
Continual requirements from the FDA include safety submissions, manufacturing compliance, and monitoring.
Marketing approval may have limitations and conditions including costly testing and surveillance.
Discovery of unknown problems can lead to restrictions, recalls, fines, or withdrawal of products.
We currently lack marketing and sales capabilities, which may hinder revenue generation.

elements.title: Legislative and Regulatory Initiatives Impacting Healthcare Costs

data.value: Significantly affected by major legislative initiatives aimed at healthcare accessibility and cost containment.
Signed into law in March 2010, aimed at reducing healthcare costs and broadening insurance access.
Uncertain future impact of healthcare reforms on pharmaceutical reimbursement.
Changes to U.S. patent law could diminish patent value and heighten complexity in patent enforcement.
Legislation that significantly modifies U.S. patent law and introduces a 'first-to-file' system.
Deterioration in economic conditions may adversely affect business operations.
Potential adverse effects on operations due to public health threats.

elements.title: Risk Factors Related to our Securities and Internal Controls

data.value: We may need to hire additional financial reporting personnel to develop internal controls and reporting procedures.
We are classified as an 'emerging growth company' and may take advantage of exemptions from certain reporting requirements.

data.value: We may issue additional shares which could dilute ownership of current stockholders.
